channel.title: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?
channel.description: EDITED THIS HOLE POST - new problems. ok, i reformatted my hd, re-installed windows, loaded up the drivers for my mobo(mother board) and installed aol (my isp). i go to download java, and when it is installing i get "error 1335... cd rom may be dirty..." i get this error again when ever i try to download then install other stuff, it wont even let me download the windows updates, so yet again if anyone can help me greatly apreciated... thanks.

@davidude36 wrote:

ok this isnt a discussion about how crap my internet is…

item.title: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

no you dont get it taylor, its not a problem with my cd, because im not isntalling anything from cd, im downloading java.
Ok well im back, i reformatted again, and re installed windows again in a bid to see if it was a problem with me installing windows, everything was fine but still i get the errors, i will screen shot all the ones i get then post them up later, ive googled all the errors and the only results i got were that people who were actually installing from a cd were having this problem.

item.title: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

You’d first try to disable your cdrom drive. maybe that’s the problem
Go to my computer > properties > Hardware > something like hardware manager i guess (i dont have an english copy of windows, hehe) and double click your cdrom-drive, disable it by selecting 'Do not use this device (i guess :P)
Hope that helps.

item.title: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

cd rom may be dirty!?!? Have you checked this error out at www.java.com?

Take a screenshot of the error next time it appears, please. That way we can quote the text and google it and see if anyone else has had the same problem. Then, you can get your solution very quickly. Until then, don’t go online with that computer. Hacked very easily without windows updates.

Read full topic

item.title: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

When java apps randomly close it is generally due to a memory error.
In the java control panel, go to the java tab, then applet runtime settings, click view. In the last box, runtime parameters, type -mx256m

This usually fixes the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

THIS IS AN SOS FROM THE DAVE MACHINE…
lawl i have totally fucked my pc, im on my 300mhz 6 year old crap mobile, ahhh ive tried everything, i attempted to re-install windows and now it just wont work, i boot up and it goes to the “start with: safe mode, last good config, start windows normally” screen, but which ever one i click on it just reboots and comes back to that screen, ahhhh id rather just reformat my hd, i have all my files that i need saved onto a memory stick, can someone just tell me how to format my hard drive from the boot screen? tyvm,
on a funnier note, my computer now sounds like a vacuum cleaner…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:

item.source: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?

item.title: [updated] Have i screwed up my pc?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

You installed UBI incorrectly.

Go to C:\Program Files\Java\your_jre_folder\lib
and rename the current rt.jar to rt_ubi.jar; and rename rt.backup to rt.jar

Read full topic
